page.title: 13FARLEIGH HOUSE: FARLEIGH
page.content: { FARLEIGH HOUSE}WAS BUILT IN 1800 AND REBUILT IN 1890. IT WAS A PRIVATE HOUSE UNTIL 1970, WHEN IT BECAME A SCHOOL FOR DYSLEXIC CHILDREN. THERE ARE 72 PUPILS: 60 BOYS AND 12 GIRLS. THE COLOUR OF THEIR UNIFORM IS BROWN AND CREAM. THEIR LESSONS ARE THE SAME AS IN AN ORDINARY SCHOOL, BUT THEY DON'T LEARN ANY FOREIGN LANGUAGES. ALL THE CHILDREN BOARD AT THE SCHOOL. THEY HAVE 9 WEEKS' HOLIDAY IN THE SUMMER, AND 4 WEEKS AT EASTER. IN THE HOUSE, THERE ARE 24 BEDROOMS AND 8 BATHROOMS. OTHER FACILITIES INCLUDE A T.V ROOM AND A GAMES ROOM. THEY MOVED INTO THIS HOUSE IN 1970 BECAUSE THEY DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH ROOM AT THE PREVIOUS SCHOOL IN BECKINGTON. THE AREA SURROUNDING THE SCHOOL CONSISTS MAINLY OF GRASSLAND, OF WHICH THE SCHOOL OWNS 24 ACRES.
